attributes.action: Keep gyms open within the second lockdown
attributes.additional_details: This can lead to more rises in mental health. It may seem a little daft at times but a gym can be a safe place to vent anger, sadness and keep  us  sane
attributes.background:
Keep gyms open in the "second lockdown"  to help the country stay fit and healthy, not only physically but most importantly mentally. 
Gyms can be a massive lifeline to many people that attend them and if like many it can be a life or death. Mental health deteriorates if we have no where to vent.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
